articles.headline: Madoff Judge Endorses Trustee’s Rule on Losses
articles.snippet: A bankruptcy judge agreed that account holders who withdrew their original investment did not suffer losses, no matter what their last statement said.
articles.abstract: A bankruptcy judge agreed that account holders who withdrew their original investment did not suffer losses, no matter what their last statement said.
articles.lead_paragraph: A federal bankruptcy judge in Manhattan has approved the fiercely disputed method used by the court-appointed trustee to calculate victim losses in Bernard L. Madoff’s enormous Ponzi scheme.

articles.headline: G.O.P. Aims for California, but Rifts Arise
articles.snippet: Senator Barbara Boxer, a three-term California Democrat, is seen as vulnerable, but divisions among Republicans have opened up in the primary.
articles.abstract: Senator Barbara Boxer, a three-term California Democrat, is seen as vulnerable, but divisions among Republicans have opened up in the primary.
articles.lead_paragraph: BURBANK, Calif. — If Republicans are to have a serious chance of capturing control of the Senate in November, they are going to have to win in traditionally Democratic states like California, where Senator Barbara Boxer, a three-term Democrat, is showing signs of vulnerability.

articles.headline: Justices Hear Appeal of Ex-Chief of Enron
articles.snippet: A lawyer for Jeffrey K. Skilling argued before the justices that poor jury selection and a vague honest-services law helped to convict his client unfairly in 2006.
articles.abstract: A lawyer for Jeffrey K. Skilling argued before the justices that poor jury selection and a vague honest-services law helped to convict his client unfairly in 2006.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Both the law under which Jeffrey K. Skilling was convicted and the way his jury was selected were the subject of skeptical questioning at the Supreme Court on Monday. The law was too vague, several justices suggested, and the jury selection too cursory.

articles.headline: Digital Billboards, Diversions Drivers Can’t Escape
articles.snippet: The effect of high-tech billboards on highway safety is being debated in state legislatures.
articles.abstract: The effect of high-tech billboards on highway safety is being debated in state legislatures.
articles.lead_paragraph: Safety advocates who worry about the dangers of distracted driving have a new concern beyond cellphones and gadget-laden dashboards: digital roadside billboards.

articles.headline: ‘Hero of Ukraine’ Splits Nation, Inside and Out
articles.snippet: Half a century after his death at the hands of the K.G.B., Stepan Bandera, a World War II partisan, can still rally Ukrainians.
articles.abstract: Half a century after his death at the hands of the K.G.B., Stepan Bandera, a World War II partisan, can still rally Ukrainians.
articles.lead_paragraph: STARYI UHRYNIV, Ukraine — Half a century after his death at the hands of the K.G.B., Stepan Bandera, a World War II partisan, has not lost his ability to rally Ukrainians against Russia — and against each other.

articles.headline: Data Shows Camrys Outside Recall Also Had Problems
articles.snippet: An analysis of U.S. federal documents showed that many Camrys built before 2007 — and not covered in recent recalls — were linked to speed control problems.
articles.abstract: An analysis of U.S. federal documents showed that many Camrys built before 2007 — and not covered in recent recalls — were linked to speed control problems.
articles.lead_paragraph: This article was reported by Bill Vlasic, Hiroko Tabuchi and Jo Craven McGinty and written by Mr. Vlasic.
articles.byline: By Bill Vlasic, Hiroko Tabuchi and Jo Craven McGinty

articles.headline: Buffett Casts a Wary Eye on Bankers
articles.snippet: In his annual letter to shareholders, Warren Buffett took a shot at Wall Street and the incentive system for corporate “advice” on deals.
articles.abstract: In his annual letter to shareholders, Warren Buffett took a shot at Wall Street and the incentive system for corporate “advice” on deals.
articles.lead_paragraph: “Don’t ask the barber whether you need a haircut.”

articles.headline: At Brown, Spotlight on the President’s Role at a Bank
articles.snippet: The campus community of Brown University is now taking notice of Ruth Simmons’s seat on the board of Goldman Sachs, which she held for 10 years.
articles.abstract: The campus community of Brown University is now taking notice of Ruth Simmons’s seat on the board of Goldman Sachs, which she held for 10 years.
articles.lead_paragraph: PROVIDENCE, R.I. — Across this quiet quadrangle, behind the wrought iron gates and beyond University Hall, lurks a bogeyman of Wall Street.

articles.headline: U.S. Considers Brake Override System
articles.snippet: The system would be meant to prevent acceleration episodes like those that have led to the recall of millions of Toyotas, said Ray LaHood, the transportation secretary.
articles.abstract: The system would be meant to prevent acceleration episodes like those that have led to the recall of millions of Toyotas, said Ray LaHood, the transportation secretary.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration may recommend that carmakers install a brake override system that is intended to prevent the sudden acceleration episodes that have led to recalls of millions of Toyotas, the transportation secretary, Ray LaHood, said on Tuesday.
